publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5370 Donald Gorrie: Involving Young People in Community Councils—That the Parliament welcomes the section in What can we do to help Community Councils fulfil their role?, the analysis of responses to the Scottish Executive discussion paper, on making greater efforts to involve young people in community councils, using such means as creating a youth sub-group, specifically involving young people in the development of recreational projects and discussing youth issues, working with school youth or pupil councils and asking Westminster to lower the minimum voting age for community council elections to 16, and encourages the Executive and COSLA to work together to promote these policies.
S2M-5370 Involving Young People in Community Councils (lodged on 21 December 2006) Robin Harper*, Rob Gibson*

S2M-5370 Involving Young People in Community Councils (lodged on 21 December 2006) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-5370 Involving Young People in Community Councils (lodged on 21 December 2006) Chris Ballance*

S2M-5370 Donald Gorrie: Involving Young People in Community Councils—That the Parliament welcomes the section in What can we do to help Community Councils fulfil their role?, the analysis of responses to the Scottish Executive discussion paper, on making greater efforts to involve young people in community councils, using such means as creating a youth sub-group, specifically involving young people in the development of recreational projects and discussing youth issues, working with school youth or pupil councils and asking Westminster to lower the minimum voting age for community council elections to 16, and encourages the Executive and COSLA to work together to promote these policies. Supported by: Robin Harper, Rob Gibson, Shiona Baird, Trish Godman, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Nora Radcliffe, Carolyn Leckie, Frances Curran, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Eleanor Scott, Chris Ballance, Mr Jamie Stone, Dr Jean Turner
